explosionsSequence.headline: To trick you into buying more and more things you don't need, fast fashion brands produce new collections every 2 weeks. That is up to

sweatshopsSequence.headline: You can afford to follow those trends
sweatshopsSequence.description: but have you wondered why clothes in the markets are so cheap?
sweatshopsSequence.zoomOutheadline: Millions of people are exploited every day to make that happen
sweatshopsSequence.zoomOutdescription: In Bangladesh, China, Turkey and your own country possibly too.
sweatshopsSequence.zoomInheadline: For a garment that cost you
sweatshopsSequence.zoomIndescription: will be payed to the worker on the other side of the globe.

textileSequence.headline: Production costs are cut in textiles too
textileSequence.description: mostly by switching to artificial, oil-derived materials like polyester.
textileSequence.zoomInheadline: Dying the textiles for mass production
textileSequence.zoomIndescription: is a lethal hazard to environment and people, including children.

substanceSequence.headline: Unfortunately natural fibers grooming is exploited as well by modifying the plants to be immune to toxic repellents which destroy natural ecosystem and are responsible for
substanceSequence.description3: hundreds of farmers dying every year.

trashSequence.headline: Having the clothes made so cheaply drasticaly shortens their lifespan and encourages you to buy new and get rid of the old. This approach leads to
trashSequence.description3: tons of unrecyclable waste every year
